record.text:
👋  Bluesky is an open social network that gives creators independence from platforms, developers the freedom to build, and users a choice in their experience. We're so excited to have you here! 

We share Bluesky updates & news from this account. A quick orientation thread: 🧵✨

• Anyone can create and subscribe to feeds. There are 50k+ feeds here, like posts from mutuals, news, or cat photos!

bsky.app/feeds

• The Discover feed shows you posts that we think you'll like. Help us fine-tune it for you by using the "Show more" & "Show less" buttons in the three-dot menu.
How do we make a custom feed? 🦋☁️

images.alt:
Find your follows (and blocks) from Twitter

You can use Sky Follower Bridge (Chrome/ium, Firefox) to quickly find your contacts on the other platform.

Reload the page between following and blocking to clear the list!

For your followers to find you using this tool, have at least one of:

- same display name,
- same handle (before the first "."), or
- your Twitter handle in your Bluesky profile (e.g. as "moved from @…",
but not "pfp[: | by] @…").

The comparisons are case-insensitive (but matching the case may be good for other tools).

Hi bsky, The domain instructions are still quite intimidating for most users, and I'm not yet seeing many organisations with multiple staff accounts. We need it to be *really* easy, with a clear example like "suppose your work domain is bantshire.ac.uk . Ask your web admin to do the following: "

Really Easy. Easier! If the instructions sounds hard (and I know it doesn't to you!) users are reluctant to bother our admins, in case it breaks something or causes trouble. And they may be reluctant to do it too, in a big company they may need to ask permission.
Also we could do with a way to guarantee the old handle is secure from getting pinched in the changeover period, in case of delay between our admins making a change and us finding out.

All that said, I'm happy for now with my un-work-domain account as it gives me the option to talk about not work! And I'm lucky as I came in early so have a base. But we really need it to be easy for the journos.
You're doing great though. It's so good to see returning users who'd got a handle ages ago but not stayed. 😍
